description: From Middle English hiena, variant of hyene, from Old French hiene, from Medieval Latin hyēna, from Latin hyaena, from Ancient Greek ὕαινα (húaina). Displaced native Old English nihtgenġe (literally "night walker").

nouns.description: hyena (plural hyenas or hyena or hyenae)

entries.meaning: Any of the medium-sized to large feliform carnivores of the subfamily Hyaenidae, native to Africa and Asia and noted for the sound similar to laughter which they can make if excited.
examples: Hyena biologists often think of spotted hyenas (Crocuta crocuta) as baboons with big teeth and relatively small brains.

entries.meaning: (Sub-Saharan Africa) A man that performs ritualized sex acts with recently widowed women and menarchal girls.
